title: NORITAKA TATEHANA Watch Face
summary: A watch face from the highly regarded fashion brand NORITAKA TATEHANA.
description: A watch face from the highly regarded fashion brand NORITAKA TATEHANA. A work of complex beauty, this watch face is decorated with crystals between which its hands pass elegantly as they turn.Supports both round and square watch faces.Via a selection button on the menu page, the watch face may be changed between white and black, and its ‘refraction effect’ turned on and off. Caution:Depending on signal level, there may be a delay of between one and three hours from installation of the app to its appearance on your Android Wear device. We recommend that you install the app via a Wi-Fi connection.< NORITAKA TATEHANA>A fashion brand established in 2010 by the artist Noritaka Tatehana. Tatehana is known for his ‘heel-less shoes’; inspired by geta, a traditional form of Japanese footwear, they are highly regarded by many as works of contemporary art for their fusion of tradition and innovation. His works are held in the collections of notable art museums around the world, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and the Victoria & Albert Museum in London. His shoes have also found favor with fashion icons like Lady Gaga and Daphne Guinness.
descriptionHTML:
A watch face from the highly regarded fashion brand NORITAKA TATEHANA.
A work of complex beauty, this watch face is decorated with crystals between which its hands pass elegantly as they turn.

Supports both round and square watch faces.

Via a selection button on the menu page, the watch face may be changed between white and black, and its ‘refraction effect’ turned on and off.

Caution:
Depending on signal level, there may be a delay of between one and three hours from installation of the app to its appearance on your Android Wear device.
We recommend that you install the app via a Wi-Fi connection.

< NORITAKA TATEHANA>
A fashion brand established in 2010 by the artist Noritaka Tatehana. Tatehana is known for his ‘heel-less shoes’; inspired by geta, a traditional form of Japanese footwear, they are highly regarded by many as works of contemporary art for their fusion of tradition and innovation. His works are held in the collections of notable art museums around the world, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York and the Victoria & Albert Museum in London. His shoes have also found favor with fashion icons like Lady Gaga and Daphne Guinness.
comments: Pretty good My only gripe is that sometimes the second hand doesn't disappear on my LG G Watch when the screen goes into power saving mode.
Nice idea I like the idea.. it's just not clear enough though.. very pixelated
Unclear The idea isn't bad, but the implementation isn't great. To difficult to read.
Almost perfect Liked the design from the beginning but I think it would be great to see the battery level while it charges.
Would love higher resolution. The image is too grainy to make the effect believable.
Looks cool on square face.1 of my faves :)
